p: Hospitalized patients with SAR-CoV-2 infection have been found to have varying white blood cell counts. A study by Huang et al. showed leukopenia (< 4 × 10 9 per L) in 25% of patients, normal leukocyte counts (4–10 × 10 9 per L) in 45% of patients, and leukocytosis (> 10 × 10 9 per L) in 30% of patients. Lymphopenia (< 1 × 10 9 per L) was found in 63% of patients ( 35). Another study by Guan et al. showed that leukopenia was present in 33.7% of patients on admission and 36.2% of the cases had thrombocytopenia ( 59). In a systematic review and meta-analysis of 43 studies involving 3,600 patients, the most common laboratory abnormalities included elevated C-reactive protein (68.6%), lymphopenia (57.4%), and elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) (51.6%) ( 72). A study done by Zhou et al. showed that elevated levels of LDH, serum ferritin, IL-6, and high sensitivity cardiac troponin I were all associated with worsening illness and higher mortality ( 73).
